I wasn't sure if i was going to like the game at first but after beating the game i felt like the game was a Short and sweet adventure really, but really, really enjoyable.

It‚Äôs an Expansion pack of the Half Life 2 game. The story continues where the main game ended and you‚Äôre escaping the Citadel. You‚Äôre finding the way in darkness in the beginning, which I consider as the spiciest part. Then, you‚Äôre fighting your way in a parking house, in a basement, in apartments, in the streets, in a hospital and at a train station. The very ending is quite hard if you have low health. 

Enjoy!

Half-Life 2 Episode One - 8.50/10 (I rate 5/10 as average)

Graphics: 5.0/10
Sound Design: 10.0/10
Soundtrack: 5.5/10
Plot: 7.8/10
Dialogue: 9.5/10
Gameplay: 9.0/10
Setting: 8.0/10

Graphics: 
I can't hold the graphics against this game as it came out in 2004. However, for 2004, these graphics were astounding. A 5/10 is average graphics. 

Sound Design: 
I can astutely tell what is going on around me in each level. It is very clear, with each enemy having a distinct sound, each gun having a distinct sound. It makes it very clear to know which enemy is coming so you can handle it. 

Soundtrack:
This soundtrack is good and amplifies the game, but I only really remember one score from it. 

Plot/Dialogue:
The plot isn't as strong as the original, but it is still good. It's a simple survival story and expands on the universe of Half-Life. The characters have logical intentions, with a logical progression as it goes on. The facial animations are also better than some of the games that have come out as of late, and this game didn't use motion capture. The dialogue is top tier and will get a good chuckle from ya. The ending is also very solid and sets up Episode Two very well.

Gameplay:
The gameplay is definitely one of the selling points of this game. The gunplay is very diverse, with a wide selection of enemies. It really gets you thinking of how to approach the situation. The level design is also extremely well-done, with the game not holding your hand and relying on environmental clues to get you through the mission. It makes the player feel smart, which is great. 

Setting:
While the colors were pretty lackluster, I really did enjoy the dystopia feel. The city feels super desolate and hopeless, which is what I believe the developers were going for. 

Final Notes:
Episode One serves as a great DLC for Half-Life and I highly recommend it those who are fans of the FPS genre and Half-life.

El primero de los episodios de half life 2 se sostiene a si mismo por medio de una reescritura del final original, cambi√°ndolo por completo para dar pie a posteriores continuaciones, lo cual es objetivamente poco o nada inteligente, puesto a que a causa de ello se pone en tela de juicio la sospechosa conveniencia argumental que la obra tiende a padecer. A nivel jugable podr√≠a decirse de que es m√°s de los mismo, si no fuera por el hecho de que ahora estamos en compa√±√≠a constante de alyx, reforzando el sentimiento de cooperaci√≥n mutua. Sin embargo, a nivel narrativo, la historia apuesta todas sus cartas desde el inicio, haciendo que la trama a posterior tienda a perder valor argumental. Aun as√≠, ‚ÄúHalf life 2 episodio uno‚Äù sigue conservando el nivel y la calidad de su predecesor, no obstante, es innegable que son contadas las innovaciones que se pueden apreciar; 9,1/10 pese a todo sigue siendo indispensable para poder disfrutar de esta excelente saga.

Decent to good episode, wished it was a bit longer since on your first playthrough you can finish the game in 2-3 hours. It has some cheap enemy placement to kill you and you don't use really a lot of weapons but it's still overall a nice expansion to play but Episode 2>Episode 1. Feeling a decent 7
Amazing continuation of the story and the excitement, couldn't have done it better. 10/10
Still a good game. Though short, it's still a proper Half Life experience and a good follow up to the second game. It's always nice to revisit the old games.

A continuation of one of the best games ever. The episodes like to push the use of the Gravity Gun a bit more and more organically than the main title in a good way, and never forced. I remember being so satisfied when I first played this years ago on the 360, my question was answered about what happens to combine soldiers if they got pecked by Head Crabs. Not very long, although the pacing of everything is still perfect. It's more Half-Life 2 with a slightly more gnawing at the back of your mind about what's going to happen next.
